tweets.text: Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa

@DrmSqnc @Feargal_Sharkey @suesustainable @EnvAgency In the 70's untreated industrial effluent & raw sewage was routinely discharged direct to rivers & sea. Still a long way to go, but the difference is massive. Sewage discharges are generally sporadic & due to sewer blockages or very high rainfall now. Good point re microplastics.
@Lucy_Wilkins1 @EnvAgency https://t.co/s9jRYpnwNZ
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Will someone else be publishing this information and recording these instead?

@Feargal_Sharkey @sascampaigns @EnvAgency I have a river at the bottom of my garden and I'd be devastated if it looked like this. I never understand why people don't care about what happens in rivers.

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Reported this pollution on river Ure Yorkshire said they would look into it over 2 hours later get a call saying where is it and they would get someone to look later that day the smell was giving me headache it was so bad. Not heard a thing since https://t.co/5N1mU4paFv

@Feargal_Sharkey @GeorgeMonbiot @EnvAgency Shocking and disgraceful.  This government just does whatever it pleases and ignores everyone else.  Not only that but it only ever seems to do awful things.  I can't think of one positive change that it has made.üò°üò°

@Feargal_Sharkey @GeorgeMonbiot @EnvAgency What is the point of an @EnvAgency if it does not publish serious pollution and the name those guilty of it?  Who holds the guilty responsible and makes them pay for clean up if not the @EnvAgency

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Just why are @thameswater so untouchable? Seriously what can we do about this? New houses in my village with Sewage bubbling up in the bath, Sewage being poured into my local river. How can we fix this?

@JustOneOcean @Feargal_Sharkey @HugoSAS @EnvAgency They are just unfit for purpose and should be disbanded & replaced with people that care about the environment rather than just speak about the environment and their lack of resources.

@Feargal_Sharkey @HugoSAS @EnvAgency Thank you for highlighting this. Incidents should be published. However, unfortunately the EA is both regulator & prosecutor for environmental pollution? As such, prosecution (publication) could suggest policy failure. Perhaps it's time to devolve departmental responsibility.

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency And 24 hours ago the Beeb was reporting this:

"Extinction: Freshwater fish in 'catastrophic' decline - BBC News" https://t.co/laXvdJ1KBB

urls.title: Extinction: Freshwater fish in 'catastrophic' decline
urls.description: Numbers are plunging due to pollution, unsustainable fishing and the draining of rivers.

tweets.text: @UnderwaterMedia @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency üëçyou have hit the nail on the head. That is the true definition of pollution, wrong material, wrong place. When houses flood with sewage because of infrastructure under-capacity urgent investment nearly always follows. Rivers......impact nobody‚Äôs homes directlyü§¨

A wet 24 hours in #Cumbria üå®Ô∏è. Several raingauges over 100mm and it's still raining üå®Ô∏è! Pleasing again that all our critical #Hydrometry raingauges appear to be working well üå®Ô∏èüòä @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice @metofficeNWEng https://t.co/ZkmK5pTbs7

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Say this again. If the same amount of sewage flowed down each individual highstreets action would be taken, but a river it is deemed acceptable as people don't care, its not their problem. When we loose what we have remember you was warned. This really boils my p**s

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency WHAT? So if the EA aren‚Äôt looking at environmental pollution, what is the point of them then? What are their targets? Looking good on social media? Their Twitter says ‚Äúit‚Äôs our job to look after your environment‚Äù. üò≥

tweets.text: @Temujin29113692 @Feargal_Sharkey @suesustainable @EnvAgency Yeah, I've heard that in the early 70s they were horrific. Before my time though. It's just a damn shame the progress is being reversed. The amount of plastic waste including microplastics surely must be more than what it was years ago though.

@DrmSqnc @Feargal_Sharkey @suesustainable @EnvAgency Immensely cleaner. In almost every way and by every measurement - chemical or ecological - more fish, more invertebrates, less pollution, more sensitive taxa etc. In the early 1970's rivers were grossly polluted. Things began to change after the the Control of Pollution Act 1974.

This week in the Tidal Thames News: Our 2021 environment webinars (16-18 March); the work of London Titan on the Thames; along with a rap intervention by @TidewayLondon; and @EnvAgency's estuary plan https://t.co/bgGMHRcaHr https://t.co/futF1PQSic

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

@FoxesAfloat Go on boys, get stuck in. Would it be any use contacting @EnvAgency ? They probably don‚Äôt have jurisdiction over the canal but I‚Äôm sure there will be a overflow somewhere where that muck is going into a river.
